filmography.title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
filmography.role_description: The mischievous fairy who causes romantic chaos in the forest; a breakout performance praised for its energy.
filmography.plot: Shakespeare's comedy about four young lovers and a troupe of amateur actors who are manipulated by fairies in a magical forest.

filmography.title: Ah, Wilderness!
filmography.role_description: The younger brother in a turn-of-the-century American family, in this adaptation of Eugene O'Neill's play.
filmography.plot: A young man in a small town in 1906 experiences the pains of adolescence and first love.

filmography.title: The Devil Is a Sissy
filmography.role_description: A tough street kid who, along with his friend, befriends a cultured British boy moving into their neighborhood.
filmography.plot: A refined British boy moves to the tenements of New York and tries to fit in with the local street gang.

filmography.title: Captains Courageous
filmography.role_description: The son of a Portuguese fisherman who befriends a spoiled rich boy lost at sea.
filmography.plot: A spoiled brat who falls overboard from a steamship is rescued by a fishing boat and made to earn his keep.

filmography.title: A Family Affair
filmography.role_description: The first appearance of the energetic, wholesome teenager Andy Hardy, launching one of Hollywood's most successful film series.
filmography.plot: Judge Hardy faces political opposition while his son Andy deals with teenage romantic entanglements.

filmography.title: Boys Town
filmography.role_description: A tough, rebellious juvenile delinquent who challenges Father Flanagan's philosophy that 'there is no such thing as a bad boy'.
filmography.plot: A priest sets up a school for wayward boys and struggles to save a particularly tough kid from a life of crime.

filmography.title: Love Finds Andy Hardy
filmography.role_description: Andy juggles three girlfriends at once while trying to buy a car, featuring a young Judy Garland.
filmography.plot: Andy Hardy is caught between three girls while trying to raise money to buy his first car.

filmography.title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
filmography.role_description: The iconic Mark Twain character who rafts down the Mississippi River with an escaped slave.
filmography.plot: Huck Finn fakes his own death to escape his abusive father and travels down the river with Jim, a runaway slave.

filmography.title: Babes in Arms
filmography.role_description: A talented young songwriter who rallies his friends to put on a show to support their vaudevillian parents.
filmography.plot: A group of young entertainers try to put on a show to prove to their parents that they can make it on their own.

filmography.title: Young Tom Edison
filmography.role_description: The future inventor portrayed as a misunderstood youth whose curiosity often leads to trouble.
filmography.plot: The early life of Thomas Edison in 1860s Michigan, depicting his experiments and struggles before becoming a great inventor.

filmography.title: Strike Up the Band
filmography.role_description: A high school drummer who dreams of leading a swing band and entering a radio contest.
filmography.plot: A high school drummer and his singer girlfriend try to convert the school orchestra into a swing band.

filmography.title: Babes on Broadway
filmography.role_description: An aspiring performer who organizes a settlement house benefit show to get noticed by producers.
filmography.plot: A group of young hopefuls try to stage a show on Broadway to help underprivileged children and launch their careers.

filmography.title: A Yank at Eton
filmography.role_description: A brash American teenager who is sent to the prestigious British boarding school Eton, clashing with traditions.
filmography.plot: An American boy is sent to school in England where he has trouble adjusting to the customs and discipline.

filmography.title: The Human Comedy
filmography.role_description: A high school student working as a telegraph messenger who must deliver news of war casualties to families in his town.
filmography.plot: A teenage telegram messenger in a small California town during WWII learns about life and loss as he delivers messages.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actor; Oscar: Win – Best Original Story

filmography.title: Girl Crazy
filmography.role_description: A playboy sent to a western mining school to focus on studies, but who instead turns it into a dude ranch with musical entertainment.
filmography.plot: A rich playboy is sent to a small college in the West, where he falls for the local postmistress and helps save the school.

filmography.title: National Velvet
filmography.role_description: A jaded former jockey who helps a young girl train a wild horse for the Grand National.
filmography.plot: A former jockey helps a young girl prepare a wild but gifted horse for England's Grand National Sweepstakes.

filmography.title: Killer McCoy
filmography.role_description: A tough kid who becomes a professional boxer to pay off his father's debts, marking Rooney's transition to adult roles.
filmography.plot: A young man becomes a prizefighter to help his father, but gets mixed up with gangsters.

filmography.title: Summer Holiday
filmography.role_description: A young man coming of age in a musical adaptation of Eugene O'Neill's 'Ah, Wilderness!'.
filmography.plot: A musical remake of 'Ah, Wilderness!' focusing on the trials and tribulations of a young man in turn-of-the-century New England.

filmography.title: Quicksand
filmography.role_description: A mechanic who steals twenty dollars to go on a date, leading to a downward spiral of crime and desperation.
filmography.plot: A young mechanic 'borrows' money from his employer's cash register, sparking a chain of events that plunges him into a life of crime.

filmography.title: The Bridges at Toko-Ri
filmography.role_description: A brave, green-top-hat-wearing helicopter rescue pilot who risks his life to save downed aviators in the Korean War.
filmography.plot: A Navy pilot redeploys to fight in the Korean War and must bomb a set of highly defended bridges, relying on rescue helicopters for support.

filmography.title: The Bold and the Brave
filmography.role_description: A soldier in World War II who dreams of opening a restaurant but is driven by a gambling addiction.
filmography.plot: Three American soldiers stationed in Italy during World War II struggle with their personal demons and the enemy.

filmography.title: Baby Face Nelson
filmography.role_description: A violent and psychotic gangster in this gritty crime drama, a major departure from his wholesome image.
filmography.plot: The rise and fall of the notorious 1930s gangster Baby Face Nelson.

filmography.title: Requiem for a Heavyweight
filmography.role_description: The loyal corner-man and trainer to a washed-up boxer, trying to protect him from the exploitation of his manager.
filmography.plot: A knockout ends the career of a heavyweight boxer, who is then forced by his manager to wrestle despite his trainer's objections.

filmography.title: It's a Mad Mad Mad Mad World
filmography.role_description: A comedy writer who, along with his partner, gets caught up in a chaotic cross-country race to find buried treasure.
filmography.plot: A group of motorists witness a car crash in the California desert and race to find the buried loot the dying driver told them about.

filmography.title: Pete's Dragon
filmography.role_description: A tipsy but kind lighthouse keeper who is the first in his town to see the titular dragon, Elliot.
filmography.plot: An orphan boy and his magical dragon come to town and live with a lighthouse keeper and his daughter.

filmography.title: The Black Stallion
filmography.role_description: A retired jockey who mentors a young boy and trains his wild Arabian horse for a championship race.
filmography.plot: A boy rescued from a shipwreck bonds with a wild Arabian stallion and trains to race him.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Supporting Actor; National Film Registry (Inducted 2002)

filmography.title: The Fox and the Hound
filmography.role_description: The voice of the adult fox who struggles to maintain his friendship with a hunting dog as they grow up on opposite sides.
filmography.plot: Two childhood friends find themselves as enemies as they grow older: one is a hunting dog, and the other is a fox.

filmography.title: Night at the Museum
filmography.role_description: A cranky, veteran night watchman who, along with his colleagues, plots to rob the museum; a notable late-career role.
filmography.plot: A newly recruited night security guard at the Museum of Natural History discovers that an ancient curse causes the animals and exhibits to come to life and wreak havoc.
